gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Physical, chemical, and biological water quality data collected from moored buoy WE04, Lake Erie in the Great Lakes region from 2014-08-01 to 2018-10-18

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: US DOC; NOAA; OAR; Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory (Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory - GLERL)
US DOC; NOAA; OAR; Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory (Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory - GLERL)
Cooperative Institute for Great Lakes Research (CIGLR - University of Michigan)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Physical, chemical, and biological water quality data collected at moored buoy WE04 in western basin of Lake Erie collected between 2014 and 2018 to support the understanding of harmful algal blooms (HABs). In situ data were collected for the following parameters, wind speed mean, wind speed maximum, air temperature, barometric pressure, depth, water temperature, specific conductivity, pH, turbidity, dissolved oxygen, chlorophyll-a, phycocyanin, dissolved organic matter, nitrate, and phosphate. Table cells with "NAN" means no data available.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: These data were collected by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory (NOAA-GLERL) and the Cooperative Institute for Great Lakes Research (CIGLR) to support NOAA-GLERLâ€™s operational development of the Lake Erie harmful algal bloom (HAB) forecasts and to directly monitor microcystin concentrations within the ecosystem.

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Related Funding Agency: US Environmental Protection Agency (US EPA - US EPA)
Suggested Author List: Cooperative Institute for Great Lakes Research, University of Michigan; National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: Great Lakes Restoration Initiative; US Environmental Protection Agency
